If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`."},"resumeAfterAlert(uint256)":{"params":{"_protocolID":"ID of the protocol to resume activity after an alert"}},"revokeConsent(uint256)":{"params":{"_patientID":"ID of the patient revoking his/her consentement"}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. documentation.text:
@title Decentralized clinical trials follow up
 @author Bruno Coupier, Samuel Edoumou, Gregory Bost
@dev Defines the Roles of AccessControl.
@dev To keep track which authority has validated protocols.
@dev to keep track which project is associated with a protocol.
@dev for multisig agreement on resuming clinical trials.
@notice ces tableaux enregistrent les infos des projets ainsi que leurs participants sur la blockchain.

@notice The events are broadcasting alerts and infos,
  and allow tracking smart contract interactions.

@notice This function adds new promoters by promoter admins.
 @param _addressPromoter the address to be added to PROMOTER role.

@notice This function adds new authorities by authority admins.
 @param _addressAuthority the address to be added to AUTHORITY role.

devdoc.author: Bruno Coupier, Samuel Edoumou, Gregory Bost

params._addressAuthority: the address to be added to AUTHORITY role.

params._addressInvestigator: the address to be added to INVESTIGATOR Roles.
params._projectID: the ID of the project, the investigator is added onto.

params._dataCID: Content Identifier on IPFS of first of initial medical records of the patient.
params._nameCID: Content Identifier on IPFS of the patient's identity record.
params._patientAddress: Address of the patient to be recruited.
params._projectID: ID of the trials project for which the patient is recruited.

params._addressPromoter: the address to be added to PROMOTER role.

params._protocolID: ID of the protocol with an alert concerned by agreement

params._newDataCID: New Patient's medical data Content Identifier on IPFS
params._patientID: ID of the patient whose medical data are collected

constructor.details: the constructor initializes the roles of promoters and authorities.

params._addressAuthority: the address of the first authority designated to be authorities Admin
params._addressPromoter: the address of the first promoter designated to be promoters and investigators Admin

params._investigatorAddress: Address of the first investigator added to the project.
params._protocolID: ID of the protocol investigated in the project.

params._descriptionCID: the Content Identifier (CID) of the protocol's description part on IPFS.
params._treatmentsListCID: the Content Identifier (CID) of the protocol's treatments list part on IPFS.

params._patientID: ID of the patient whose data CIDs need to be retrieved

params._protocolID: ID of the protocol whose data CIDs need to be retrieved

params._address: Address of the person subject of the role inquiry

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

params._protocolID: ID of the protocol to resume activity after an alert

params._patientID: ID of the patient revoking his/her consentement

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params._patientID: ID of the patient whose medical data are alarming
params._protocolID: ID of the protocol concerned by the alert
ID of the protocol to be validated

agreedOnResume.details: for multisig agreement on resuming clinical trials.

protocolIDToProjectID.details: to keep track which project is associated with a protocol.

protocolValidatedByAuthority.details: To keep track which authority has validated protocols.

devdoc.title: Decentralized clinical trials follow up

promoterAdded(address).notice: The events are broadcasting alerts and infos,  and allow tracking smart contract interactions.

addAuthority(address).notice: This function adds new authorities by authority admins.

addInvestigator(address,uint256).notice: This function adds new investigators on a project by a promoter

addPatient(address,uint256,string,string.notice: Investigators can recruit new patients with this function and initially register their consent

addPromoter(address).notice: This function adds new promoters by promoter admins.

agreeOnResume(uint256).notice: This function collects agreement of promoters and authorities to resume clinical trials

collectData(uint256,string).notice: Investigators collects medical data of their patients using this function

createProject(uint256,address).notice: Promoters can create new projects with this function

createProtocol(string,string).notice: Promoters can create new protocols with this function

getPatientDataCIDs(uint256).notice: This function allows retrieving data CIDs of a patient

getPatients().notice: This function returns the patients array

getProjects().notice: This function returns the projects array

getProtocolCIDs(uint256).notice: This function allows retrieving data CIDs of a protocol

getProtocols().notice: This function returns the protocols array

getRole(address).notice: This function returns the role associated with the provided address

protocols(uint256).notice: ces tableaux enregistrent les infos des projets ainsi que leurs participants sur la blockchain.

resumeAfterAlert(uint256).notice: This function allows resuming clinical trials with agreement of promoters and authorities

revokeConsent(uint256).notice: Patients  can revoke their consent using this function

setAlertOn(uint256,uint256).notice: Investigators trigger an alert for a protocol using this function

validateProtocol(uint256).notice: Authorities can validate protocols with this function
